description: UMD 3.5.0 is the fifth update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
releaseNotes: <div>This release contains the following products:</div><div>Accounting:<br></div><div>APEL SSM 2.2.1 released in SL5 and SL6:<br></div><div><ul><li>This is a minor released which changes the behavior of the start and abort a transaction and raise exception when not connected during send_all.<br></li></ul></div><div>Storage Management:<br></div><div>Storm 1.11.3 released in SL5 and SL6:<br></div><div><ul><li>This release provides fixes for security vulnerabilities that were recently reported, and several bug fixes namely at the level of the webdav service.</li></ul></div><div>Credential Management:</div><br><div>ProxyRenewal v. 1.3.35 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>This is a revision for ProxyRenewal, which makes sure 1024-bit keys are explicitly requested from Globus, overriding the current Globus default of 512 bits.&nbsp;</li></ul></div><div>Authorization:</div><div>Globus GSISSH v. 5.3.10 released SL6:<br></div><div><ul><li>This release it incorporate changes from the standard openssh package and its now SHA-2 compliant.&nbsp;</li></ul></div><div>Information Model:</div><div>LB 4.0.12-1 released in both SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>This is a maintenance release of L&amp;B which provides some fixes for packaging, rare memory handling issues, permissions for integration with CREAM, and improvements in the reliability of the Site Notification Keeper.</li></ul></div><div>Job Scheduling:</div><div>QCG BROKER v. 3.2.0 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>This release provides support for SHA2 certificates together with support for iRODS, http transfer and an extension in GetFactoryAttributes method in order to support SLURM. There also an enhancement of the support for parallel and multi-scale applications.</li></ul></div><div>Other:</div><div>Dpm-Yaim v. 4.2.17 released in both sl5 and sl6:</div><div><ul><li>This is a maintenance release to address some specific problems related with dpm-xroot and dav filesystem configuration.&nbsp;</li></ul></div><div>GridSite v. 2.2.1 release in both Sl5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>This is a revision of GridSite, turning off server-side TLS tickets support, which has been turned on by default since OpenSSL 1.0.&nbsp;</li></ul></div><div>APEL PARSER &nbsp;v. 2.2.1 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>This is a minor release which introduces some small tuning like the catch for xml parser exceptions to fix db loader crash or the way SLURM parser handles the time unit prefixes.&nbsp;</li></ul></div><div>BLAH v. 1.20.4 released in Sl5 and Sl6:</div><div><ul><li>This released provides a fix for the MPI support for SLURM jobs.</li></ul></div><div>CanL v. 2.2.1 released in SL5, SL6 and debian:</div><div><ul><li>This revision contains library dependencies cleanups, warnings fixes, and improved packaging together with &nbsp;bug-fix, related to key usage extension value in proxy certificates created with the library.<br></li></ul></div>
installationNotes: All products in the UMD 3.5.0 release were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the documentation links) to support 64 bit Scientific Linux 5 and Scientific Linux 6 (x86_64 processor architecture). Some products are also supported in 64 bit Debian 6 (squeeze). &nbsp;Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.
contact: For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the EGI Helpdesk to make a report.
knownIssues: <div>Details containing known issues and workarounds found in EGI verification and staged rollout are collected in: https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-3:UMD-3.5.0</div>
changeLog: <div>This releases includes updates for the following products:</div><div><ul><li>Apel parser<br></li><li>Apel ssm<br></li><li>Blah<br></li><li>CnaL<br></li><li>Dpm-Yaim <br></li><li>Gridsite<br></li><li>GSISSH<br></li><li>Qcg-broker<br></li><li>Qcg-broker-client<br></li><li>Lb<br></li><li>ProxyRenewal<br></li><li>Storm<br></li></ul></div>

products.name: dpm.dmlite
products.description:
DMLite is the new core library used by the DPM and LFC components.
 It's plugin based and exposes functionality for namespace management, pool management and i/o access.
 The figure belows gives an overview of the existing interfaces, which all new DPM and LFC daemons use.

products.name: emi.apel-parser
products.description: APEL (Accounting Processor for Event Logs) is a tool that gathers CPU accounting information by parsing batch system and blah accounting log files and inserts it into a local MySQL database. APEL then publishes the data into a centralised repository.

products.name: emi.apel-ssm
products.description: APEL (Accounting Processor for Event Logs) is a tool that gathers CPU accounting information by parsing batch system and blah accounting log files and inserts it into a local MySQL database. APEL then publishes the data into a centralised repository.

products.name: emi.blah
products.description:
The CREAM (Computing Resource Execution And Management) Service is a simple, lightweight service for job management operation at the Computing Element (CE) level.



CREAM accepts job submission requests (which are described with the same JDL language used to describe the jobs submitted to the Workload Management System) and other job management requests (e.g. job cancellation, job monitoring, etc).



CREAM can be used by the Workload Management System (WMS), via the ICE service, or by a generic client, e.g. an end-user willing to directly submit jobs to a CREAM CE. For the latter user case a command line interface (CLI) is available.



CREAM exposes a web service interface.
products.releaseNotes: Fixed the following bugs: * CREAM-112 - sge_local_submit_attributes.sh problem with memory requirements

products.name: emi.canl
products.releaseNotes:
CANL-c: This revision contains library dependencies cleanups, warnings fixes, and improved packaging

        CANL-java:  This release contains a single bugfix, related to key usage extension value in proxy certificates created with the library.

products.name: emi.glite-proxyrenewal
products.description: The proxy renewal daemon runs as an internal component of the WMS node, which is responsible for keeping proxy certificates valid throughout all the lifetime of corresponding jobs. The daemon maintains a repository of proxy certificates that have been registered by the WMS for renewal. After succesfull registration of a proxy, the WMS refers to the repository file whenever it needs access the proxy of a particular job. When the finishes the WMS unregisters the proxy from the repository.
products.releaseNotes: This is a revision for ProxyRenewal, which makes sure 1024-bit keys are explicitly requested from Globus, overriding the current Globus default of 512 bits.

products.name: emi.gridsite
products.description: The Module Architecture implemented by GridSite extends Apache by adding extra components at the access control and HTTP method execution layers, and supports CGI services supplied with GridSite or written by third parties. mod_gridsite is a loadable module for the Apache web server which provides access control and page formatting for GridSite HTTP(S) Fileservers, Websites and Web Services hosts. mod_gridsite also intercepts some processing in the standard mod_ssl module to support GSI Proxies and VOMS attribute certificates, as well as the normal X.509 client certificates. The verification of these credentials is handled by functions within mod_gridsite and the main GridSite shared library, without the need to patch or rebuild mod_ssl

products.name: emi.lb
products.description: The Logging and ookkeeping service (LB for short) was initially developed in the EU DataGrid project1 as a part of the Workload Management System (WMS). The development continued in the EGEE, EGEE- II and EGEE-III projects,2 where LB became an independent part of the gLite3 middleware, and then in the EMI

products.name: emi.storm
products.description: StoRM (STOrage Resource Manager) is a storage manager service (SRM) for generic disk based storage system, compliant with the standard SRM interface version 2.2. StoRM provides data management capabilities in a Grid environment to share, access and transfer data among heterogeneous and geographically distributed data centres.In particular, StoRM works on each POSIX filesystems (ext3, ext4, xfs, basically on everything than can be mounted on a Linux machine) but it also brings in Grid the advantages of high performance storage systems based on cluster file system ( such as GPFS from IBM or Lustre from Sun Microsystems ) supporting direct access (native POSIX I/O call) to shared files and directories, as well as other standard Grid access protocols. StoRM is adopted in the context of WLCG computational Grid framework.
products.releaseNotes:
StoRM Backend v. 1.11.3

          StoRM Frontend v. 1.8.4

          StoRM GridHTTPs Server v. 3.0.0

          YAIM StoRM v. 4.3.4

          StoRM SRM client v. 1.6.1

products.name: epel.globus-gridftp-32
products.description: The Grid Security Infrastructure (GSI) from the Globus Toolkit

products.name: ige.globus-gram5
products.description: The Grid Resource Allocation and Management (GRAM5) from the Globus Toolkit

products.name: ige.globus-gridftp
products.description: The GridFTP server and clients from the Globus Toolkit

products.name: ige.globus-gsissh

products.releaseNotes: For information specific to the RPM packaged version of the software see the file /usr/share/doc/gsi-openssh-5.3p1/README.sshd-and-gsisshd
products.changeLog: Incorporate changes from the standard openssh package

products.name: ige.gsisshterm
products.description: GSI-SSHTerm is a java based client to GSI enabled SSH

products.name: qcg.qcg-broker-client
products.description: QCG-Broker is a successor of the Grid Resource Management System (GRMS) project. QCG-Broker was designed to be an open-source meta-scheduling framework that allows developers to build and easily deploy resource management systems to control large-scale distributed computing infrastructures running queuing or batch systems locally.

products.name: qcg.qcg-broker
products.description: QCG-Broker is a successor of the Grid Resource Management System (GRMS) project. QCG-Broker was designed to be an open-source meta-scheduling framework that allows developers to build and easily deploy resource management systems to control large-scale distributed computing infrastructures running queuing or batch systems locally.
